page.title: 17Population
page.content: From a very small village in the c12 with a few houses around the church, Cheddleton has grown and now has a population of around 6500. Two housing estates were built soon after W.W.1, but most of the expansion has occured during the last 20 years and more houses are scheduled to be built next year. In Victorian times there would not have been more than a few hundred residents. The population of St.Edwards Hospital has decreased. There have been as many as 1500 patients - now in the region of 650. Most of the people work in the pottery towns or in nearby Leek or Cheadle.
